text: Tap at brewpub. Pours clear gold. Aroma and flavor are spicy rye, citrus, pale malt, soft grassiness, and crisp, piney, hoppy, dry finish. Light/medium body.
pint at the brewery, this is in the top 5 of all pool beers. very clean, hoppy, moderate high carbonation and extremely drinkable.
Draft @ the brewery. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Draught at the brewery pub. Pours hazy yellow with a large, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy grassy, herbal and citrus hops with light grainy cracker malt. Flavor is heavy citrus and grassy hops and bitterness with light grainy cracker malt and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
(En fût à la brasserie): Un mélange herbeux, citron frais et un bon apport protéiné juste à point. La finale est très sèche, plus que la moyenne Alpine. Buvabilité déraisonnable.

Draft at Alpine. Pours clear gold with a creamy white head and decent lacing. Tastes like hop resin, grapefruit, some pine, and toasted malt. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like hope resin, grapefruit, and biscuit malt.

A sessionable version of Nelson? Are you kidding me? This beer is spot on from its heartier full version. Nice funky cat pissy nelson hops come through along with some citrus notes. Growler up on this one because it just may be the best session IPA around.

[ Keg ][ 2oz ][ Festival of Dankness ][ ~$2 ][ Plastic Taster ][ 8.22.15 ]
>> Multiple pours of this one. Clear straw, good foam. Nose is birthday cake and buttercream frosting. Taste is similar. Rye driven chewy body, not heavy though. Amazingly drinkable, no harsh bitterness, not sticky. No paper, dust, chemicals - flawless.
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose and taste are citrus, pretty bitter, nice session

Draught @ Festival of Dankness, San Diego, CA. Pours a clear yellow colour with a small head. Aroma of citrus, bread and gooseberry bush. Flavour of crisp citrusy bitterness, quite mellow bready maltiness, herbs and some pineapple. Medium bodied. Nice.

Draught @ Modern Times Festival of Dankness, San Diego, CA

Pours yellowish with a small head. Aroma of zesty lemon, citrus and grapefruit. Taste is smooth, lemony and citrusy with some juicy fruits and hints of bready malts. Finish is zesty lemony, grapefruity and hoppy with some bready maltiness. Feels heavier than it actually is.

Tap @ Festival of Dankness, San Diego.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Nice hop profile, fruity aroma, faint rye too. Sweet juicy fruits, resinous hops, caramel. Nice session brew.
4414
Draught @ Festival of Dankness, San Diego. Aroma is sweet with pineapple juice and tropical fruits. Flavour has gooseberry bush, tropical fruits and mild mineral notes. Quite refreshing.

Type: 64-oz. growler
Glass: Figueroa Mountain pint glass
From: Alpine Beer Company in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $12.82
Purchased: Aug. 5, 2015
Consumed: Aug. 5, 2015
Misc.: N/A 

Poured a golden, pale, clear color with two fingers of frothy, white head. A few noticeable bubble marks coming up from the bottom of the glass. Average amount of uneven, foamy lacing on the sides of the glass. Above average retention on the top all the way down. (Sight - 3.75)

Smelled a pleasant whiff of sharp red grapefruit, Citra, Amarillo, resin, tangerine, floral, tropical, mango, pineapple, spicy Simcoe and caramel. Reminding me a lot of a Duet or a Keene Idea. (Smell - 4.63)

Taste followed the nose, although not quite as potent. Definitely an Alpine beer, reminding me of some Keene Idea, Duet, San Diego Surprise and Nelson. Got Citra, Amarillo, floral, grapefruit, tangerine rind, rye, light resin, orange zest, tropical, pineapple, caramel and buttery malts. (Taste - 4.25)

Light body. Thin-to-oily texture. Average carbonation. Long, floral finish. (Feel - 4.00)

This was an awesome session IPA, definitely the best one Ive ever had. Great for August and very good for any time. Loved it. (Overall - 4.25)

4.28 95 A

Growler @ home, thanks to nightrider for sending! Pours a clear, golden appearance with an off white head. Good carbonation. Pine stank, lots of onion / garlic, juicy aroma. Very potent and inviting. Mouth feel is a bit creamy and the body is a bit more full than I was expecting. Overall, pretty dry. Lots of onion and pine and resin. Some grapefruit and tropical fruit juices. Cracker. Not much aftertaste. Super sessionable. Nice.

Draught at Toronado pub, San Diego. Light peach colour. Bit light on the aroma, but definitely get some of that Nelson hop coming out. Taste is right amount of Nelson - not too much. Not a big fan of the old NS, but this is tasty. Nice bitter finish. Overall, good session IPA.
Hard to find a better session IPA than this. Clear gold, white head. Tropical fruits, melons, grassy hops, juicy and just fucking awesome. seriously a beer I would drink all the time. Thanks Anthony!
Growler. Apparently gluten free? This is maybe the best session Ipa. Winey grape, tropical fruit, spice
Pale gold pour with a white head. Aroma is light and resin which is dry and earthy and fruity. Light, refreshing and tasty.

Draught at the brewpub in Alpine. Somewhat hazy pale golden/yellow beer with a small offwhite head. Incredibly fresh fruity aroma, grapes, pine apples, mango, peach, apricot, citrus, grassy notes. Pine apple flavor, mango, peach, apricot, oranges, grassy notes, quite bitter after a while but most of all full of lovely troåical fruits. Hugely drinkable, I want more!
